result.execSummary:
The defendant Nyomi Rose Stone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
All financial obligations paid through the Clerk of Courts office are subject to civil judgment and certification to the Department of Revenue on any balance owed after 60 days from entry of judgment. 
The defendant is placed on a payment plan of $100.00 a month starting 8/1/22

All financial obligations paid through the Clerk of Courts office are subject to civil judgment and certification to the Department of Revenue on any balance owed after 60 days from entry of judgment.
The Def is to contact Ashland Co Jail to make arrangements to provide a DNA specimen w/in 7 days.

records.addlTxt:
01:00 PM Defendant Nyomi Rose Stone in court with attorney Blake Gross.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   COVID - ZOOM; all parties agree to appear via ZOOM today. Agreement as in the offer to settle. Ct finds the def know and vol waives right to be present in the court room. PLEADS NC to count 2. Signed PLQ, understands elements. Ct accepts pleas, factual basis in the compl, finds the def G on Count 2, Count 1 is DRI. State comments on sentencing. Atty comments on sentencing. Def makes statments to the court. 
Ct orders-- See attached offer to settle
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there.
11:36 AM - Def came to COC window to sign bond and handed her NOH paperwork for her upcoming 6/6/22 hearing.
